annotation.spannedText: Vaccines (or needles or baby shots) are the best way to protect against some very serious infections

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines (or needles or baby shots) are the best way to protect against some very serious infections

annotation.spannedText: It should be given to children soon after their first birthday

classMention.mentionClass: It should be given to children soon after their first birthday

annotation.spannedText: This vaccine should also be given to adults who are not protected against measles, mumps or rubella

classMention.mentionClass: This vaccine should also be given to adults who are not protected against measles, mumps or rubella

annotation.spannedText: Pregnant women who have been told that they are not protected against rubella, should receive MMR vaccine as soon as they are no longer pregnant

classMention.mentionClass: Pregnant women who have been told that they are not protected against rubella, should receive MMR vaccine as soon as they are no longer pregnant

annotation.spannedText: Protection from measles, mumps and rubella after getting the vaccine is life-long and further doses are not required

classMention.mentionClass: Protection from measles, mumps and rubella after getting the vaccine is life-long and further doses are not required

annotation.spannedText: The MMR vaccine is safe and effective

classMention.mentionClass: The MMR vaccine is safe and effective

annotation.spannedText: Most individuals will have no reaction

classMention.mentionClass: Most individuals will have no reaction

annotation.spannedText: Allergic reactions to the MMR vaccine are very rare

classMention.mentionClass: Allergic reactions to the MMR vaccine are very rare

annotation.spannedText: There is no evidence that the MMR vaccine causes autism

classMention.mentionClass: There is no evidence that the MMR vaccine causes autism

annotation.spannedText: The vaccine is safe for household members of people with immune system problems and household members of pregnant women

classMention.mentionClass: The vaccine is safe for household members of people with immune system problems and household members of pregnant women

annotation.spannedText: The vaccine can cause a malaise and fever, possibly with a rash, in approximately five per cent of children six to 23 days after MMR immunization

classMention.mentionClass: The vaccine can cause a malaise and fever, possibly with a rash, in approximately five per cent of children six to 23 days after MMR immunization

annotation.spannedText: There are some groups who should generally not be given the vaccine

annotation.spannedText: The vaccine is safe for household members of people with immune system problems
